page.title: 05WALL ROMAN SITE.
page.content: Letocetum, the small Romano-British settlement at Wall, Staffordshire, lies on the old Roman Imperial route,Watling St., which ran from London to Wroxeter branching off to Chester. Along the Imperial routes posting stations were set up where horses could be changed and overnight lodging obtained. Wall was one of these stations and appears to have been a large settlement with substantial buildings. A bathhouse and the remains of a large mansion are visible with excavations still being carried out by the Staffordshire Archaeological Society. During early excavations numerous cremation burials were discovered along Watling St. to the West of Wall; several of the vessels are on display in the site museum together with other artefacts found on the site. The site is owned by the National Trust.
